basics.name: Subhadip Mitra
basics.label: Strategic Leader in Data, AI & Cloud Innovation
basics.summary: Senior Technology Leader with 15+ years of experience driving enterprise transformation through Data, AI, and Cloud innovations. Proven track record of building and mentoring high-performing teams, developing strategic roadmaps, and delivering significant business impact. Passionate about building the next generation of products and services at the intersection of Generative AI and Large-Scale Data Platforms.

work.name: Google Cloud – Professional Services Organization, Southeast Asia
work.position: Data & Analytics Manager | Site Lead, PSO Southeast Asia
work.summary: Serving in dual roles as Data Analytics Manager and Site Lead, responsible for architecting innovative, data-driven solutions and overseeing cross-practice engagements across AI, Data Analytics, Infrastructure, Application Modernization, and Security.
highlights: Transformed Google Cloud Platform's Data & Analytics practice across Southeast Asia by building and leading high-performing teams, delivering 50+ enterprise-scale projects with 100% customer satisfaction and proactive escalation management.
Published ARTEMIS - an adaptive multi-agent debate framework transforming real-time decision-making.

Developed and executed regional go-to-market strategies, including Data Monetization frameworks, Data CoE models, and Cross-Cloud architectures, resulting in significant market expansion and revenue growth across JAPAC.
Led delivery governance for the Southeast Asia portfolio, ensuring consistent project delivery and revenue realization across multiple domains.
Built and nurtured C-suite relationships with strategic partners and enterprise clients, establishing Google Cloud as the preferred digital transformation partner in the region.

Drove technical innovation through contributions in multi-agent decision-making and context modeling, including the creation of the ETLC (Extract, Transform, Load, Contextualize) framework for the GenAI era.
Engineered privacy-centric protocols (Open Location Proof & Open Consent Protocol) for secure data sharing and transparent consent management.

work.name: Standard Chartered Bank
work.summary: Led enterprise-wide data & analytics transformation and strategy initiatives, influencing C-suite stakeholders across retail banking divisions.
highlights: Directed transformation initiatives that integrated alternative data sources with advanced AI/ML models, significantly reducing deployment times.
Spearheaded the bank's MarTech modernization strategy, aligning business and technology teams to deliver significant customer impact.
Mentored high-performing teams and established new standards for model deployment efficiency.
Developed scalable platforms and governance frameworks driving data monetization, privacy, and cloud adoption.

work.summary: Provided strategic advisory and delivered large-scale data platforms for Fortune 500 clients across APAC.
highlights: Architected petabyte-scale data processing platforms and real-time analytics solutions.
Built trusted C-suite relationships and drove digital transformation initiatives.
Mentored cross-functional teams and established best practices in data architecture and cloud migration.

highlights: Collaborated with C-level executives and banking partners for Thailand expansion.
Established architectural patterns and governance frameworks for mission-critical payment systems.
Built and mentored engineering teams to deliver high-performance integration solutions.

projects.name: Open Location Proof (olp-protocol.org)
projects.summary: A privacy-aware open protocol for non-repudiable location verification in physical or virtual spaces. GoLocate.me is a planned implementation node demonstrating the protocol.
highlights: Developed a novel protocol for privacy-preserving location verification.
Designed to be decentralized and tamper-resistant.
Applicable across industries such as supply chain, finance, and social networking.

projects.summary: A transparent, fast, and scalable protocol for managing user consent and privacy on public blockchains.
highlights: Proposed a blockchain-based solution for transparent consent management.
Designed for compliance with data privacy regulations like GDPR.
Automates consent enforcement and revocation using smart contracts.
